item.description:
Historic Architecture of Manchester Tour

The Currier Museum of Art and Its Neighborhood

Presented by the Manchester Historic Association in partnership with the Currier Museum of Art.

Sunday, September 23, 2012

12:00 p.m.-5:00 p.m.

Tickets: $20 in advance - $25 day of tour

Please call now to reserve your ticket at the discounted price - (603) 622-7531.

Tickets may also be purchased on the day of the event at the Unitarian Universalist Church (669 Union Street).

Manchester Historic Association and Currier Museum of Art members receive a $5 discount

For an extra $10 you can join the Manchester Historic Association.

Children 12 and under free

 

This year’s Historic Architecture of Manchester Tour focuses on the Currier Museum of Art and the architecturally significant neighborhood surrounding it. The tour will include interior tours of Currier, the Unitarian Universalist Church, the Holy Trinity Polish National Catholic Cathedral, the Jewish Federation of New Hampshire, Temple Adath Yeshurun, Trendsetters Hair Salon (155 Myrtle Street), B. Byron Chandler House/St. Hedwig's Convent (147 Walnut Street, 17 Oak Street (private residence) and 282 Prospect Street (private residence).  

Ticket holders may tour the interior of these properties on their own and in any order they wish, and also may take a guided walking tour of the neighborhood (starts at 12:30 p.m.), or a guided tour of the Currier Museum of Art (starts 2:30 p.m.). Handouts will be available that includes a map plus historical and architectural information about the properties and about the neighborhood. Free parking is available on the street, and in the Temple Adath Yeshurun, Jewish Federation of New Hampshire and Currier Museum of Art parking lots.  

Please wear comfortable walking shoes!
item.name: Historic Architecture of Manchester Tour
